title: Why buff Darius?
body:
He's currently the most banned top laner and has maintained top 2 most banned toplaners for a long while.

This champ is already S tier, buffing him will only increase his ban rate, and most people don't wanna deal with his bullshit.
Clearly Riot is favoring the pro scene instead of looking at the state of soloque for most players.

Darius is not "S" tier. The only reason that people ban him so often is that he's a lane bully that people don't know how to play against. It isn't that hard to walk into him during his Q so he doesn't get a stack/heal or to basically not fight extended trades so he stacks his passive (gives AD and massive bleed). I guarantee most of the players here complaining try to fight extended trades into him or are the greediest players in terms of creep score while they're being zoned for already making mistakes. Here are some tips against Darius: Short trades and disengage, don't fight until after he burns Q or W on minions, don't trade UNTIL he reaches 5 stacks , walk into him so he doesn't get healing or stack (this is why jax and irelia are easy picks into this champ).

Bans are heavily waited towards personal hatred of a characters mechanics. It is why Yasuo, Zed, and Darius tend to have high ban rates no matter what state they are in. No one wants to deal with windwall eating their attacks while Yasuo is surfing a minion wave, no one wants to have a character become untargetable and reappear and oneshot you, and no one wants to have some ridiculously tanky bruiser flash onto them cc chain them and instantly kill them with a refreshable true damage attack.

I don't think he needs a buff at all, but I actually enjoy both playing and fighting Darius.  Nothing more satisfying in the game than getting back to back dunks.  When playing against him if you're playing a good duelist (ya know, most top laners), if you hug him when he Q's you can absolutely poop on him as he spends a full second charging up an attack that does minimal damage.

Ranged matchups are also interesting.  Ranged characters can bully the ever loving hell out of him, but if he runs flash + ghost and gets a single hook on you... oh baby you better start panicking.

That said you don't see him too much because he's always banned, and for good reason.  He hard counters a lot of top laners and playing safe in League of 20 minutes doesn't accomplish anything except making games 4v5.
